text: Hi All, how to import csv to HubDB with Multi-Select fields? Thanking you in advance
I'm about to do this tomorrow and I'm not sure how it works as well. I was thinking of exporting some data first to see how it is and then import it <@UE70ED6JV>

If you are looking to clean up the CSV and then push data to HubSpot, a tool which provides you 2 way sync might be a good fit. Would suggest <http://Superjoin.ai|Superjoin.ai>.

They allow you to do 2 way sync b/w HubSpot and Google Sheets.
Thank you <@U04CC57CMBP> and <@U071MV78SGZ>. I am trying to use comma but not working when I import in HubDB to multi-select field
Could you please show me how? quick video demo will do. thanks
Hey <@UE70ED6JV> try using semicolon ; instead of comma ,
Still not working on my end :disappointed:

Okay so I just did a test <@UE70ED6JV> and it worked.
First I exported the table to see how it looks
Then I imported it with an extra option and it worked
So I think it has to be comma separated with no spacing
But also the options (first,second,third) I already had them in the HubDB as options
I am not sure if you can "create" options. Probably not
I am not sure if you can "create" options. Probably not --- >  I am looking on this solution where you can automatically create those multi-select field from imported CSV? is that possible?
I am not sure but I would say no

I was trying to import like for example different industries or company name around 50 items plus, so there is no nice way to do it but to manually create those in multi-select field. Thanks for confirming
Yeah you would need to select all unique fields and add them as options to the multi select column first
